result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendel Jabar King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance upon release to Extended supervision shall be due immediately.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit of 20 days, January 1-20, 2015.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek/maintain fulltime work.  Must regularly participate in a HSED or GED program.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of controled substances without a valid pprescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia, drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or distributing.
No possession of any firearms or weapons; including firearm ammunition, holster or body armor.
May not live or work where a gun is located.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00.
May not have more than one phone number registered or held in his name at one time.
May not possess more than one phone at one time.
May not have contact with any known gang member or associate.
Complete paternity action if not already done.  Comply with all child support Court orders.
Complete parenting or fatherhood course, and Batterers Intervention counseling.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictios: firearm possession and voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.13 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box D260
cf

Defendant Kendel Jabar King in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Kendel Jabar King in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 20 days (January 1 -20, 2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or for the Substance Abuse Program.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any cash bail to apply and any remaining balance is to be returned to the remitter. Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia, drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or distributing.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons; including firearm ammunition, holster or body armor.
- Defendant may not live or work where a gun is located.  
- Defendant is not to possess case currency in an amount greater than $150.00.
- Defendant may not have more than one phone number registered or held in his name at one time.
- Defendant may not possess more than one phone at one time. 
- Defendant must regularly participate in a HSED or GED program.
- Seek/Maintain fulltime work.
- Complete paternity action if not already done.
- Defendant to comply all child support court orders.
- Defendant may not have contact with any known gang member or associate. 
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course.
- Complete Batters Intervention Counseling.
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

Defendant Kendel Jabar King in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Kendel Jabar King in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case scheduled for Court Trial. Court finds the Defendant is GUILTY as charged in the information. 
The Court denied the defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.
The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdict and ordered that a judgment of conviction be entered on the record.
Court orders Defendant remanded pending Sentencing. Defense requests the Court to reconsider remand. Arguments heard. Court denies the Defense motion to reconsider the remand. 
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 1-20-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendel Jabar King in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Defendant Kendel Jabar King in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court Trial continues. Defense rests. State rests. Court advises the defendant on right to testify.  Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to testify. Closing Argument by State and Defense. Court orders case adjourned for Court Trial on 11-26-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Court trial scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of State's witnesses.
